verse.name: v1
verse.lines: By yon bonnie banks and by yon bonnie braes Where the sun shines bright on Loch Lomond, Where me and my true love were ever wont to gae, On the bonnie, bonnie banks of Loch Lomond.

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: Oh! Ye'll take the high road, and I'll take the low road, And I'll be in Scotland afore ye, But me and my true love we'll never meet again, On the bonnie, bonnie banks of Loch Lomond.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: 'Twas then that we parted, in yon shady glen On the steep, steep side of Ben Lomond, Where in purple hue, the Highland hills we view And the moon coming out in the glooming.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: The wee birdies, and the wildflowers spring And in sunshine the waters are sleeping, But the broken heart it kens nae second spring again, Tho' the waeful may cease frae their grieving.
